definitions: a substance used as a preparatory coat on previously unpainted wood, metal, or canvas, especially to prevent the absorption of subsequent layers of paint or the development of rust

examples.text: new plaster should be treated with a primer

definitions: a cosmetic applied to the face before another product, intended to improve the coverage and lasting effect of the second product

examples.text: it's best to apply primer around the eye to help the makeup blend properly

shortDefinitions: cosmetic applied to face before another product

definitions: a cap or cylinder containing a compound which responds to friction or an electrical impulse and ignites the charge in a cartridge or explosive

examples.text: the nitro-cellulose is ignited by the spark that comes from the primer

shortDefinitions: cap containing compound which ignites charge

definitions: a small pump for pumping fuel to prime an internal combustion engine, especially in an aircraft

examples.text: no more than four pumps of the primer usually suffice

definitions: a molecule that serves as a starting material for a polymerization process

examples.text: the duplex RNA primer cannot initiate DNA replication

etymologies: late Middle English: from medieval Latin primarius (liber) ‘primary (book)’ and primarium (manuale) ‘primary (manual)’

definitions: an elementary textbook that serves as an introduction to a subject of study or is used for teaching children to read
shortDefinitions: elementary textbook that serves as introduction to subject of study
